Posts.Content: jlstacey wrote: Hey ladies, I am asking this for a friend. She felt a lump and had a mammo and US done. She is waiting to talk to her doctor, but she has read the report from the US. It indicated a regular benign cyst and "complicated cyst". Has anybody ever had this term on a report? Her mom had breast cancer. She is going to ask for a biopsy, which hasn't been ordered. She is trying to gather more info. Thanks everyone! Posts.Title: Complicated Cyst jlstacey jlstacey

Posts.Content: Dec 24, 2015 09:25PM jlstacey wrote: I was in a very similar situation. On 12/23/14 I found a lump on my breast. I couldn't get an ultrasound and mammogram until 1/6/2015! The waiting sucked. Distractions that were worked for me were friends, my family and doing whatever I wanted to! I felt it was a good time to indulge myself some. Go to the movies, read, do whatever is fun for you. Try to find something that will take your mind off things. What about volunteering at a shelter or soup kitchen? And of course, read on here. During the first 6 months of 2015, I spent MANY hours on here! I wish you luck and hope that everything is OK. Happy Holidays!
Posts.Title: Not diagnosed but scheduled for biopsy. BrandyR jlstacey

Posts.Content: Dec 20, 2015 05:55PM jlstacey wrote: My PT sessions are 45 minutes and she is doing mainly myofascial release with me. I have about a half hour of exercises that I do at home twice a day. Every session, she adds more exercises to my at-home program. I am about 5 sessions in and she says I am half way. My PT is post-mastectomy and it is for cording and to release tightness, and then she is sending me on to another facility to strengthen my upper body for my DIEP flap surgery in 8 weeks. If you think you are making the same progress you were making previously, then your sessions are probably right. Perhaps bring up your concerns with your PT.
Posts.Title: How long should physical therapy sessions last Sallyellen BrooksideVT

Posts.Content: Mar 10, 2016 01:27PM jlstacey wrote: Oh yes, that is exactly how I was after diagnosis. Once I got a treatment plan and started moving forward with it, I felt a lot better. My friends really supported me at that time. My girlfriend spent a lot of time with me while our kids wee in school and DH was at work so I wasn't alone.
Posts.Title: Going through a very down moment... Nina27 Nina27

Posts.Content: Feb 7, 2015 06:53AM jlstacey wrote: I had long hair when dx and lots of it. When I was waiting for the biopsy results I decided if it was malignant I would cut my hair and donate it. So on 1/28 I cut my hair off and donated it. It's about chin length and should start falling out at the end of this week. I never even thought about doing a cold cap, even though I still need to come to terms with losing my hair.
Posts.Title: Anyone choose NOT to use 'cold caps'? rleepac sbelizabeth

Posts.Content: jlstacey wrote: Hi all, I was TNBC. At dx, I was clinically stage IIa, but after chemo I was Ia. I had chemo with residual disease of 8mm, but nothing was found in my lymph nodes during surgery. I have an appointment with my MO on Monday to follow up on a chest CT. The chest CT is just to follow a couple lung nodules, which don't look suspicious. I've been having headaches and a change in taste so I'm talking to my MO about that. What kind of things have you experienced with brain mets? I'm trying not to dwell on it, but that's hard to do!
